details.script_description: This script runs GROMACS simulations to calculate the minimum distance between two alpha-synuclein proteins (aSyn) over different lambda values (representing a range of conditions) and outputs the minimum distance and number of contacts between the two proteins in XVG files. The script uses PBS (Portable Batch System) for job submission and resource allocation.
details.workflow: The script iterates over ten simulation directories (two_aSyn_1 to two_aSyn_10) and then over three lambda values (1.00, 1.10, 1.12) within each directory. For each lambda value, it generates an index file (aSyn1_aSyn2_lambda*.ndx) to define groups for the two aSyn proteins and calculates the minimum distance between them using gmx mindist. The output files are stored in a data directory within each lambda directory.
